intro: Hieracium ardoinoanum, commonly known as the Appalachian yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has serrated, alternate leaves. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. It is often found in shaded areas and is considered a native species with ecological importance in its habitat.
